chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory K Welsh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Battery to Emergency Rescue Worker, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(7)(b).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must appear at probation by 4pm on 6/2/16.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office. To be paid on a monthly payment plan of $25.00 beginning on 8/1/16 and on the first of each month thereafter. Failure to pay will be warrant.
Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to the COCC. To be paid on monthly payment plan as set forth. Failure to pay will be warrant.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Absolute Sobriety.
Not to have contact with: Helen Yourchuck. 
Not to have contact with: Melissa Welsh. 
Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Cannot vote until civil rights are restored. 
Cannot hold elected office.

Other civil rights may be lost until restored, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.
Must complete Anger Management assessment and comply with recommendations.
Must complete AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Banked jail time to be used by agent if necessary.
